sen.j: 箕作 阮甫（みつくり げんぽ、寛政11年9月7日 (旧暦)（1799年10月5日） - 文久3年6月17日 (旧暦)（1863年8月1日））は、日本の武士・津山藩士､蘭学者である。
sen.e: Genpo MITSUKURI (October 5, 1799 - August 1, 1863) was a Japanese samurai, a feudal retainer of the Tsuyama Domain and a Dutch scholar.
Genpo MITSUKURI (October 5, 1799 - August 1, 1863) was a Japanese samurai, feudal retainer of the Tsuyama Domain and Dutch scholar.

sen.e: Genpo MITSUKURI (October 5, 1799 - August 1, 1863) was a Japanese samurai, feudal retainer of the Tsuyama Domain and Dutch scholar.

As a Feudal Retainer of the Tsuyama Domain
tit.cmt: 不定冠詞を付けました。

sen.j: 津山藩医箕作貞固（三代丈庵）の第三子として美作国西新町（現在の岡山県津山市西新町）に生まれる。
sen.e: Genpo was born the third son to Teiko MITSUKURI (third-generation 'Joan', a doctor of the Tsuyama Domain) in Nishishinmachi, Mimasaka Province (present-day, Nishishin Cho, Tsuyama City, Okayama Prefecture).
Genpo was born the third son to Teiko MITSUKURI (Joan the third, a doctor of the Tsuyama Domain) in Nishishinmachi, Mimasaka Province (present-day, Nishishin Cho, Tsuyama City, Okayama Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 「三代丈庵」の表現を修正しました。
sen.e: Genpo was born the third son to Teiko MITSUKURI (Joan the third, a doctor of the Tsuyama Domain) in Nishishinmachi, Mimasaka Province (present-day, Nishishin Cho, Tsuyama City, Okayama Prefecture).

sen.j: 医家としての箕作は、阮甫の曾祖父箕作貞辨（初代丈庵）からで、西新町に住み開業した。
sen.e: The MITSUKURI family was famous for having engaging in the medical practice for generations; the great-grandfather of Genpo, 貞辨 MITSUKURI (first 'Joan'), started a doctor's business in Nishishinmachi.
The Mitsukuri family had been engaged in medical practice since 貞辨 MITSUKURI (Joan the first) started to work as a general practitioner in Nishishinmachi.
sen.cmt: ・「医家としての箕作」は個人名ではないので、頭文字のみ大文字にしました。・「貞辨」の読みは不明でした。・表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: The Mitsukuri family had been engaged in medical practice since 貞辨 MITSUKURI (Joan the first) started to work as a general practitioner in Nishishinmachi.

sen.j: 父貞固の代になり天明2年10月24日 (旧暦)（1782年11月28日）津山藩主越前松平家の「御医師並」に召し出されて十人扶持をもって町医者から藩医に取り立てられた。
sen.e: While practicing medicine as the second generation of the MITSUKURI family, Genpo's father, Teiko, was summoned to the 'Oishinami' of the ECHIZEN-MATSUDAIRA family of the Tsuyama Domain on November 28, 1782 and received a promotion from a town doctor to a Domain doctor as well as rewards of Junin fuchi (the equivalent of an annual ten-man rice stipend).
sen.cmt: 「御医師並」：読み方、意味共に不明瞭です。
sen.e: In November 28, 1728, Genpo's father, Teiko, was promoted to 'Oishinami' (domain doctor) of the Echizen Matsudaira family, the lord of the Tsuyama Domain, with a salary of Junin fuchi (the equivalent of an annual ten-man rice stipend) from a town doctor.
sen.cmt: 前半と後半は同じ内容なので表現を簡略にしました。
sen.e: In November 28, 1728, Genpo's father, Teiko, was promoted to 'Oishinami' (domain doctor) of the Echizen Matsudaira family, the lord of the Tsuyama Domain, with a salary of Junin fuchi (the equivalent of an annual ten-man rice stipend) from a town doctor.

sen.j: 阮甫は4歳で父をなくし、12歳で兄箕作豊順をなくして、家督を相続することになる。
sen.e: After losing his father at the age of four and his older brother, 豊順 MITSUKURI, at the age of 12, Genpo succeeded to the reigns of the family.
After having lost his father at the age of four and his older brother, 豊順 MITSUKURI, at the age of 12, Genpo succeeded to the reigns of the family.
sen.cmt: ・「豊順」の読みは不明でした。・時系列を明確にしました。
sen.e: After having lost his father at the age of four and his older brother, 豊順 MITSUKURI, at the age of 12, Genpo succeeded to the reigns of the family.

sen.j: 藩の永田敬蔵（桐陰）・小島廣厚（天楽）から儒学を学ぶ一方、文化 (元号)13年（1816年）には京都に出て、竹中文輔のもとで3カ年間医術習得にはげんだ。
sen.e: While learning Confucianism from Keizo NAGATA (alias. Toin) and Hiroatsu KOJIMA (alias. Tenraku), Genpo visited Kyoto in 1816 to immerse himself in medical science to obtain as much knowledge and skills as possible under Bunpo TAKENAKA for three years.
sen.cmt: 永田敬蔵（桐陰）・小島廣厚（天楽）：読み方不明です。
sen.e: While learning Confucianism from 永田敬蔵(桐陰)and 小島廣厚(天楽), Genpo visited Kyoto in 1816 to study medicine under Bunpo TAKENAKA for three years.
sen.cmt: ・人物名はいずれも複数の読み方が可能なため、日本語標記に戻しました。・表現を簡略にしました。
sen.e: While learning Confucianism from 永田敬蔵(桐陰)and 小島廣厚(天楽), Genpo visited Kyoto in 1816 to study medicine under Bunpo TAKENAKA for three years.

sen.j: 文政2年（1819年）には、修業を終えて京都から帰り、本町三丁目で開業、翌年大村とゐと結婚した。
sen.e: After three years of medical training, Genpo returned from Kyoto to begin practice as a doctor in Honcho in 1819, and got married to Toi Omura in the following year.
sen.cmt: 本町三丁目：本町（ほんちょう）で訳しています。読み方不明です。
sen.e: After three years of medical training, Genpo returned from Kyoto to work as a doctor in 本町三丁目 in 1819, and got married to Toi Omura in the following year.
sen.cmt: ・「本町三丁目」の読みは不明なので、日本語標記にしました。・表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: After three years of medical training, Genpo returned from Kyoto to work as a doctor in 本町三丁目 in 1819, and got married to Toi Omura in the following year.

sen.j: やがて高50石御小姓組御匙代にすすみ、文政6年（1823年）には、藩主の供で江戸に行き、宇田川玄真の門に入り、以後洋学の研鑚を重ねる。
sen.e: He later received a promotion to 御小姓組御匙代 with salary of 50 koku (13.9 cubic meters), and in 1823, Genpo accompanied his Domain lord to visit Edo and entered the school of Genshin UDAGAWA to further educate himself on Western studies thereafter.
sen.cmt: 石御小姓組御匙代：読み方、意味共に不明です。
sen.e: He later was employed as an apprentice domain doctor with a salary of 50 koku (13.9 cubic meters), and in 1823, Genpo accompanied the lord of the domain to visit Edo and started to study Western studies under Genshin UDAGAWA.
sen.cmt: ・「御小姓組御匙代」の正確な読みは不明ですが、「小姓」の定訳を利用すると「召使医師」となります。この頃、20歳前後だったので「見習い医師」として藩に採用されたのではと推測します。・表現の簡略化をしました。
sen.e: He later was employed as an apprentice domain doctor with a salary of 50 koku (13.9 cubic meters), and in 1823, Genpo accompanied the lord of the domain to visit Edo and started to study Western studies under Genshin UDAGAWA.

tit.cmt: 不定冠詞を付けました。

sen.j: 徳川幕府天文台翻訳員となり、マシュー・ペリー来航時に米大統領国書を翻訳、また対露交渉団の一員として長崎市にも出向く。
sen.e: Genpo was appointed as a translator of the astronomical observatory of the TOKUGAWA shogunate and translated an official letter from President of the United States which was brought by Matthew (Calbraith) PERRY, and also visited Nagasaki City as a member of negotiators with Russia.

sen.j: 蕃書調所の首席教授に任ぜられ、幕臣に取立てられた。
sen.e: Genpo was also appointed as a leading professor of Bansho shirabesho and promoted to the Shogun's direct retainer.
Genpo was also appointed as a leading professor of Bansho shirabesho (the Institute for Western Studies) and promoted to the Shogun's direct retainer.
sen.cmt: 「蕃書調所」は補足が必要と判断しました。定訳がありましたが、不適切な訳語だったので別の表現を用いました。
sen.e: Genpo was also appointed as a leading professor of Bansho shirabesho (the Institute for Western Studies) and promoted to the Shogun's direct retainer.

sen.j: 日本最初の医学雑誌『泰西名医彙講』をはじめ、『外科必読』・『産科簡明』・『和蘭文典』・『八紘通誌』・『水蒸船説略』・『西征紀行』など阮甫の訳述書は99部160冊余りが確認されており、その分野は医学・語学・西洋史・兵学・宗教学と広範囲にわたる。
sen.e: It has been confirmed that 99 different volumes of books (160 copies) were translated by Genpo, with genres ranging from medical science, language, history of the Western world, to military science and philosophy of religion; his prominent translations include "Geka Hitsudoku", "Sanka Kanmei", "Oranda Bunten", "Hakko Tsushi", "Suijosen Setsuryaku" and "Seisei Kiko".

It is confirmed that Genpo translated 99 titles (nearly 160 volumes in total) including "Taisei Meii Iko" (literary, Western medicine), the first medical journal in Japan, "Geka Hitsudoku" (literary, essentials for surgery), "Sanka Kanmei" (literary, a brief explanation about obstetrics), "Oranda Bunten" (literary, grammar of Dutch language), "Hakko Tsushi" (literary, the overview of world history), "Suijosen Setsuryaku" (literary, a brief explanation about steamboat), "Seisei Kiko" (literary, records on the Western world) and his specialty ranged from medical science, language, history of the Western world, to military science and philosophy of religion.
sen.cmt: ・「泰西名医彙講」が抜けていました。・翻訳では「160冊」を160 copies としていますが、これだと「同じ本が160部」の意なので99部も含めて修正しました。・それぞれの著書は補足が必要と判断しました。
sen.e: It is confirmed that Genpo translated 99 titles (nearly 160 volumes in total) including "Taisei Meii Iko" (literary, Western medicine), the first medical journal in Japan, "Geka Hitsudoku" (literary, essentials for surgery), "Sanka Kanmei" (literary, a brief explanation about obstetrics), "Oranda Bunten" (literary, grammar of Dutch language), "Hakko Tsushi" (literary, the overview of world history), "Suijosen Setsuryaku" (literary, a brief explanation about steamboat), "Seisei Kiko" (literary, records on the Western world) and his specialty ranged from medical science, language, history of the Western world, to military science and philosophy of religion.

sen.j: 阮甫の子孫には有名な学者が多数輩出している。

sen.e: The birthplace of Genpo still remains in Nishishin Town, Tsuyama City.
